title: Agelasimine
text:
Agelasimines are a group of <a href="adenine">adenine</a>-related bicyclic <a href="terpenoid">diterpenoids</a> isolated from the orange <a href="sea%20sponge">sponge</a> "<a href="Agelas">Agelas</a> <a href="Agelas%20mauritania">mauritania</a>". Their chemical structures are closely related to the <a href="agelasine">agelasine</a>s.
Both groups of compounds display a range of biological activities, such as cytotoxicity, inhibition of adenosine transfer into rabbit <a href="erythrocyte">erythrocyte</a>s (red blood cells), Ca2+ channel antagonistic action, <a href="Alpha-1%20adrenergic%20receptor">α1 adrenergic</a> blockade and others.
Both compounds have been reproduced in the laboratory by <a href="organic%20synthesis">organic synthesis</a>.
